Package model

Class MinesweeperModel

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
model.MinesweeperModel
public class MinesweeperModel extends Observable
Author:
Taoseef Aziz, Matteus Wilson, Luke Genova, Amimul Zoha FILE: MinesweeperModel.java ASSIGNMENT: Project 6 COURSE: CSc 335; Section 001; Spring 2022 PURPOSE: This class defines an object that would be used to represent the model of the Minesweeper game which use the MVC architecture. The model stores data and alters the data its holds based on events that happend in the view and were validated in the controller. The data it holds is the grid itself and the status of each square, the number of mines that are left on the grid, and a timer that keeps track of the time the user has been playing in seconds. The model also follows the Observer/Observable design where the model is the Observable and notifies the observer(the view) that it has updated its data. FIELDS: gameState : GameState CONSTRUCTORS: MinesweeperModel(int gridSize, int numMines) METHODS: public MinesweeperModel(int, int) public addObserver(Observer) public saveGameState() public loadGameState() public getGameState() public getNumMines() public changeSquare(int, int, SQUARE_STATUS) public getAdjacentMines(int, int) public getTime() public incrementTime() public makeMove(int, int) public () private guessSpecificSquare(int, int) private guessNearby(int, int) USAGE: Run using Minesweeper.java, never directly run apart from testing purposes.

  • Constructor Details

    • MinesweeperModel

      public MinesweeperModel(int gridSize, int numMines)
      MinesweeperModel Constructor for the minesweeper model object. Initializes a new GameState object which contains a grid of UNGUESSED enums, timer set to 0 and hitmine set to false.
      Parameters:
      gridSize - The size of the grid that will be used to play.
      numMines - The number of mines that will be placed.

      Overrides:
      addObserver in class Observable
      Parameters:
      o - an observer to be added.

    • saveGameState

      public void saveGameState() throws IOException
      Saves the current state of the game.
      Throws:
      IOException - If there was a generally failure of reading from the stream, such as a file not existing, it throws the exception to the caller.

    • loadGameState

      public boolean loadGameState() throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException
      Loads the current game.
      Returns:
      true if the board matched sizes, false if it didn't
      Throws:
      IOException - If there was a generally failure of reading from the stream, such as a file not existing, it throws the exception to the caller.
      ClassNotFoundException - If the class that was read from the input stream was not found, throw the exception to the caller.

    • getGameState

      public GameState getGameState()
      Getter for the the current state of the game (gameState state object) maintained in the model
      Returns:
      a GameState object that is the part of the model keeping track of the current time, board state and hitMine status. Returns the current state of the game.

    • getNumMines

      public int getNumMines()
      Returns the number of mines that are still in the board.
      Returns:
      The number of mines that are left on the board as an integer.

    • incrementTime

      public void incrementTime()
      Increments the time counter by one.

    • changeSquare

      public void changeSquare(int x, int y, SQUARE_STATUS status)
      Changes the state of the square at the specified location to one of the following enum states: 1) UNGUESSED 2) GUESSED 3) FLAGGED 4) MINE 5) FLAGGEDMINE
      Parameters:
      x - integer x coordinate position on the game grid.
      y - integer y coordinate position on the game grid.
      status - represents the new enum status to be applied to the desired location.

    • makeMove

      public boolean makeMove(int x, int y)
      Makes a move that the user made by selecting on of the tiles on the grid.
      Parameters:
      x - The x position of the grid that the user selected
      y - The y position of the grid that the user selected.
      Returns:
      True if the move was successful.

    • getAdjacentMines

      public int getAdjacentMines(int x, int y)
      This method returns the number of mines that are adjacent to a specific tile on the player grid.
      Parameters:
      x - The x position of the specific tile
      y - The y position of the specific tile
      Returns:
      The number of mines that are adjacent to a specific tile.

    • getTime

      public int getTime()
      Getter for the time value stored in the gameState state object
      Returns:
      integer representing the amount of time that has elapsed since the player has made their first move.

    • guessSpecificSquare

      private boolean guessSpecificSquare(int x, int y)
      Called when player left-clicks the grid at a valid location. This method reveals the current square and recursively explores adjacent squares that have zero adjacent mines. Calls changeSquare() if a valid location is selected and returns a boolean indicating whether the guess caused any changes.
      Parameters:
      x - integer x coordinate position on the game grid.
      y - integer y coordinate position on the game grid.
      Returns:
      boolean indicating whether the guess caused any changes.

    • guessNearby

      private void guessNearby(int x, int y)
      Calls makeMove at surrounding positions relative to location specified by parameter coords to find other squares with 0 adjacent mines
      Parameters:
      x - integer x coordinate position on the game grid.
      y - integer y coordinate position on the game grid.

    • isMineHit

      public boolean isMineHit()
      This method determines if a mine was hit after a move was made.
      Returns:
      True if a mine was hit, false otherwise.
